result.execSummary:
The defendant David A Charpentier was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber granted
Report clean and sober
Consecutive to: any other sentence

Submit DNA and pay surcharge
Attorney fees to be paid
Payment Plan for balances and Attorney fees: $50.00/month commencing on August 1, 2017

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David A Charpentier

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant David A Charpentier in court with attorney Erik C. Johnson.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CM25, 16CM97, 16CM99 and 16CM142 tracking together:
  Atty Hendee states that in 15CM25 the state has a motion to terminate the DPA and the defendant has no objection.  Atty Johhson agrees to the termination.  Defendant agrees.
BY THE COURT:  Court will terminate the DPA in 15CM25 and finds the defendant guilty of that charge and enters the conviction as of today's date.

  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Ct. 1 in 15CM25, Ct. 3 in 16CM97 and Ct. 1 in 16CM142.  Counts 1, 2 & 4 in 16CM97 to be dismissed and Counts 2 & 3 in 16CM142 and Ct. 1 in 16CM99 to be dismissed and read-in.
Atty Johnson agrees.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 1 in 15CM25, Ct. 3 in 16CM97 and Ct. 1 in 16CM142.  
Counts 1, 2 & 4 in 16CM97 to be dismissed
Counts 2 & 3 in 16CM142 and Ct. 1 in 16CM99 to be dismissed and read-in.

Atty Hendee asks the court to follow the joint recommendation.
Atty Johnson makes sentencing arguments.

BY THE COURT:  15CM25, Ct. 1:  Court orders 30 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber; consecutive to any other sentence
  Report on or before June 2 , 2017 by 7:00pm, clean & sober.
Court Costs = $243.00
$100 Domestic Abuse Surcharge
  DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
bond to be applied to all cases, first on restitution
Attorney fees to be paid

16CM97, Ct. 3:  Court orders 60 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber; consecutive to any other sentence
Report on or before June 2 , 2017 by 7:00pm, clean & sober.
Court Costs = $243.00
  DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
Attorney fees to be paid

16CM142, Ct. 1:   Court orders 60 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber; consecutive to any other sentence
Report on or before June 2 , 2017 by 7:00pm, clean & sober.
Court Costs = $243
DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
Credit = 1 day
Attorney fees to be paid

16CM99:  Restitution = $25.37
Attorney fees to be paid

  Defendant agrees to the $15.00 payment plan fee.
Payment Plan for the balances of costs and Attorney fees:  $50.00/month commencing on August 1, 2017

Counts 1, 2 & 4 in 16CM97 to be dismissed
Counts 2 & 3 in 16CM142 and Ct. 1 in 16CM99 to be dismissed and read-in.
Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 5, 2017 at 11:15 am.

Attorney Erik C. Johnson in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Johnson asks for a plea/sentencing date.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Plea/Sentencing
bond continued.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 5, 2017 at 11:15 am.
Return date on February 15, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant David A Charpentier in court with attorney Erik C. Johnson.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
16CM99 & 16CM142 tracking together:
Atty Johnson asks the court if he will be appointing him on 16CM142.    Atty Johnson enters a Not Guilty plea.    Atty Hendee states that bond needs to be set along with booking.

BY THE COURT: Court appoints Atty Johnson on 16CM142.
Not Guilty plea entered.

  Atty Hendee has no objection to a signature bond with conditions.

  BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
*Appear for booking today

Atty Johnson asks that the matters be set together.
BY THE COURT:  All matters including 16CM97 and 15CM25 will track together.
  Return date scheduled for February 15, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
